actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a business credit relating to the use of clean-fuel and fuel efficient vehicles by businesses within areas designated as nonattainment areas under the Clean Air Act, and for other purposes.
subjects: Hybrid, electric, and advanced technology vehicles

summary.text:
Clean Vehicles Incentive Act of 2015

Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow certain businesses located in areas designated as nonattainment areas under the Clean Air Act a general business tax credit for the cost of certain clean-fuel vehicle property and the use of clean-burning fuel.

Allows a new qualified hybrid motor vehicle tax credit for any taxable year after 2014 only for such a vehicle which is placed in service after December 31, 2014, by an eligible business and substantially all of the use of which is in a nonattainment area. Extends such credit to new hybrid vehicles purchased after: (1) December 31, 2009, and before January 1, 2015, or (2) December 31, 2014, and before January 1, 2020.

titles.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a business credit relating to the use of clean-fuel and fuel efficient vehicles by businesses within areas designated as nonattainment areas under the Clean Air Act, and for other purposes.
